text: and there are multiple ways to Define
addiction of course but in medicine when
we think about um when people come to
for health care we think of addiction in
terms of the DSM term the DSM is the
diagnostic and statistical manual um
it's produced by the American
Psychiatric association and in that book
it has a clear definition of what
addiction is
addiction typically we think of it as
people may exhibit tolerance to a
substance they may go through withdrawal
when they don't have the substance uh
they may spend um increasing amount of
time um engaged in the behavior to uh
obtain or use the substance they may
have had unsuccessful number
unsuccessful attempts to cut down their
use of the substance they may use
despite the fact that they are having
psychological or physical problems these
are sort of the Hallmarks of uh of
addiction so like when people use the
term in popular culture um they
typically have another perspective in
mind some people use things like I'm a
shopping addict I'm a chocolate adct or
something and that's a more uh benign
use of the term but then there are other
people who use the term and they think
of things like folks who will steal
steal your money and Rob you they're
addicts you can think about it from a
biological perspective uh with alcohol
people tend to think of folks who uh
have a parent for example who was an
alcoholic um they may have an increased
likelihood of becoming dependent on
alcohol um why that's the case we're not
entirely sure but people are looking at
genetics and other bi biological markers
but we're not real sure but we certainly
think that they may have an increased
likelihood um and then there are of
course there are important social
factors um during certain certain points
of your life you may be more likely to
uh be addicted to a substance because of
some conditions under which uh you are
experienced uh you don't have a job uh
you don't have any responsibilities you
have greater access to a particular
substance than you normally would have
all of these things could increase the
likelihood of someone becoming addicted
